comment.text: Nice, loved it. Great atmosphere!  We went on a brisk evening with the fireplace on and sat outside.  So cozy!

This neighborhood pub was hopping on this cool November day.  The inside was packed and the patio (with heaters) was full.  The menu had a lot of variety in food and drinks.  We tried the Krispy Kreme donut burger with sweet potato waffle fries.  The donut had been grilled so the sugar had caramelized.  The burger was delicious.  We tried the Bold Rock Hard Cider and it was a light flavor added to the meal. This is a great place to come with friends. Good service. Nice bathrooms. Handicapped accessible.

Its a chill atmosphere but the food is only  mediocre. Don't  get the pulled pork egg roll, it's like a  Frankenstein recipe!

I'll come back to hang out but not  to eat.

I ordered the standard Cypress Burger. The meat itself was good. While the outside of the burger was closer to being "well done," the inside was more medium. Neither were the medium-well that I requested, but it was certainly edible. I added American cheese (for a buck, which I think is a little ridiculous). The sweet and tangy pickles added a nice pop of flavor to the sandwich, but it could have benefited from some grilled onions or special sauce (the former of which would have added another dollar). The bun was light and fluffy, which offset the slightly overdone patty. Overall, the burger was good but not necessarily memorable.

The sweet potato waffle fries were delicious. Crispy on the outside, soft and slightly mushy on the inside--just how I like them.

I wouldn't describe the service as hospitable, but our orders were correct and our drinks were refilled regularly. I can't ask for much more than that.

The tucked-away nature of the restaurant and the inside pub-like atmosphere inside were both nice. The shaded patio out front would make for a great happy-hour spot on a nice day.

This is one of my favorite neighborhood bars in Atlanta. It has the perfect vibe for an evening drink, a satisfying meal or to chill with your friends in a big group. Seldom do you find places that offer all of the above.
To top it off it's not expensive at all and the service is pretty decent (especially given how crowded it can get).

It has an outdoor patio area (during winter, they light up an outdoor fireplace for you to stay warm and people get together and drink in a circle around it - it's super chill)
Their indoor seating is comprised of booths mostly with an additional room for big parties. The booths offer a more intimate setting with dim lighting where as the big  group dining area is better lit and the music volume is slightly lower.

Best part (yes, another best part).. their menu is small but has a variety of cuisines and usually this is a red flag.. but they somehow make it work. All the way from apps to main course.

All in all a great place to hang out when you want to "go out", have a quality meal at a buzzing neighborhood bar without burning a hole in your pocket.

Great food! 

The lamb burger was Amazing. 
Pizza rolls, Awesome.
Fried chicken rolls, Epic.

Good spot to grub at.

I've been here a few times and Cypress has never disappointed me. Cheap (but good!) beer + good bar food.

I especially like their sweet potato nachos! I've finished an entire plate on my own in one night before. They are tangy, sweet, and slightly spicy and a wonderful pairing to the array of beers at Cypress.

Covid-related note: this is a good place to hangout during the pandemic. Tables are far apart and the waiters are relatively conscious about the safety regulations. I've been here before the pandemic too and had a great experience.
Every time I think about the story where Babe Ruth points to the outfield then hits a home run, I think about this place - 5 Stars

Our first visit (with kids) was refreshingly nice!  And despite it being crowded we were in and out within an hour.  I like concept of finding your own table.  The Dylan was awesome...he was friendly to the kids and got our order RIGHT - meaning he listened!  The crowd was youngish - mid 20s to 30s if I'd guess.  A come as you are attire.  
The only reason for the 4 was the chicken tenders were cooked a little too long.
Great food. Great prices. Good people. Perfect for an afternoon meal on the patio or a game
The food was average. The service was great. Ambiance was a fun, loud place to hangout. The restaurant is located behind the building of the listed address.

My wife landed in Atlanta about 10pm and was hungry after her flight from LA. We did a quick search for late night eats near the Georgia Tech Hotel. Cypress Street came up, we took a walk to check it out. This is a happening place at 11:30 at night on a Thursday.

As we approached you could tell immediately this was a popular hangout bar in the area. The sound of music and people talking really loudly permeated out into the streets. The sound was augmented by their outdoor seating area.

We could not get a real feel for the inside as it was so dark but we saw to the right just inside they had a seating area and tables. We had a seat and were greeted right away by someone with menus. My wife ordered the fish and chips and we each ordered a drink. The drinks were served quickly and the Fish and Chips shortly thereafter.  I had already eaten earlier and did not order anything to eat.

My wife says the fish and chips hit the spot but it was not knock your socks off.

Overall this was a good experience and served our purpose. Cool interior too!

photos.caption: Checked in. And I literally got a free high five from our server!!!

comment.text: I picked this restaurant on a whim as I flew into Atlanta late and it was still taking orders through Uber Eats. I am on the road 320 nights a year for work and often order from Uber Eats or DoorDash and have had my share of American sports bar food. I ordered the quesadilla and chicken fingers and was BLOWN AWAY. Hands down, the pulled chicken quesadilla was one of the BEST quesadillas I've ever had- period. The chicken fingers were excellent but that quesadilla was legendary. I've been back a few times and everything on their menu is good. This is one of Atlanta's best kept secrets. Try it out. You won't be disappointed!!!

We've heard good things about Cypress Street Pint & Plate so we decided to give it a try for brunch. 

Looks like a normal pub inside. They do have a patio outside which can hold large parties. 

I started off with a mimosa ($3). I was taken back by the price but the taste also reflected the price. Either the orange juice or the sparkling wine tasted off. 

I initially ordered the Nashville chicken and waffle but was told it was not available. So I decided on the chicken biscuit with fries ($11). For the presentation and what you get, the value is not there. A chicken biscuit from chick-fil-a has a better value and taste. The fries were cold as if they were sitting out for a while. 

I was not the only with a problem. My friends frittata was supposed to come out with collard greens but came out with cole slaw instead. 

I'm not sure I would give it another chance and don't recommend it for brunch.

I was visiting some friends at Ga Tech and was looking for a restaurant in close proximity to the campus which is how I ended up here. Super casual restaurant, no hostess to seat you rather it's seat yourself, there's a full bar, and outdoor dining options in the cold months due to the overhead heaters. The food was basic and the server was rude! I had the pretzel and brownie. Every time I asked her for something she seemed bothered except when I needed change to leave a tip. I would not recommend this place. I will not be back.

I find myself coming back here all the time. I love that they are open late, so I can get late night food on nights when everything else is closed. Their food is awesome, it's not bar food at all. Plus they have great drinks and lots of beers on tap. It's become a great brunch spot too. During the day this is a great place for a date but at night it's a great bar hangout with good food. 

I tried: 
Strawberry spinach arugula - this salad was great. Very simple and it hit the spot. 
Peanut Jake salad- this is like a thai salad. It's heartier, it was my date's main entree. He thoroughly enjoyed it.   

Roasted chicken Marsala - this was my main entree. It was delicious! Much better than I expected it to be. Though to be honest, I ordered it when I saw a table next to me order the entree.  It consisted of thing but long noodles, with the perfect Marsala wine sauce and chicken. 

Drinks: 
Oaxacan dead- this drink wasn't my favorite but it was strong. 

Mezcal , cucumber, lime- this drink was very sweet but very  good. I would try this one again. 

Farmers smash - this one contained gin, mint, and green tea. I loved it, and it was  very smooth

Cypress is a restaurant I came across on Yelp for late night eats. I was coming from the Mercedes stadium so it was super close. 

I got there around 1AM and was told I could sit anywhere. There's inside and outside seating and I chose to go indoors which was just as dark as outside. Do we not believe in dim lighting? Candles? Something? 

It took about ten minutes for a server to come by and bring water. That's all the time I needed to select what I wanted from the very limited late night menu. 

I ordered the sweet potato nachos. The sweet potato makes it healthy, ok? It was delicious and a great sized portion. If I were to go back I would try the pizza egg rolls. My brother in law had that and he loved it. 

My negatives are the bathrooms being dingy, slow service and little to no lighting.
We enjoyed having the Pickleback and Black Bean burgers. My husband enjoyed his IPA. Can't wait to come back and try Fish and Chips!

Would rate closer to 3.5 Yummy bar food. They have a nice outdoor patio with plenty of seating inside. Got their bbq egg rolls to start which were delicious. For my entree ordered their September special burger which was the Chipotle Peanut Butter Burger. Don't judge pb on a burger until you've tried it! It is delicious. Their fries were awesome and crispy as well. Service was good. Would return!

One of my favorite local spots in midtown! They have cheap good quality beers (local ipa) and their brunch is always a big hit! Love the huevo rancheros and chilaquiles.  Dinner is also great with the chicken sandwich.
Great brunch.  Drinks and food were great as was the service.  Highly recommended brunch spot.
Great atmosphere whether it's hot or cold. Outdoor heaters for when it's cold, the drinks are great food is very good. Great place to bring friends and hangout.

We were able to sit outside on the patio, which was extremely nice. First come first serve for getting a good table. The inside was pretty dark so I think being outside made the meal more enjoyable. We had a large group of 10, so service was of course slow. But we enjoyed our time at Cypress. Food was good

great place to go for a cool outdoor/hangout environment! service is a little on the slower side, so as long as your aren't rushing to eat you'll be fine. lots of seating indoor + outdoor, seat yourself, always good deals on drinks, & yummy food!

6-star ambience, 5-star food, 4-star service.   Cool somewhat hidden gem on a back alley in a hip neighborhood.

The ambience of this place is just terrific.  Cypress Street used to be a back alley to access parking garages along Peachtree and West Peachtree Streets.  These days, with the full-on gentrification of this part of Midtown, and the construction of dozens of high rise and mid-rise condos, Cypress is now a pedestrian friendly tree-lined oasis with cafes, etc.   There is outdoor seating that feels like a neighborhood beer garden, and indoor seating with a very friendly bartender.

Food here is terrific pub grub.  Chicken fingers had some sort of special spice that gave them a little kick and set them far apart from the usual.  Fried green tomatoes were exactly right: crispy outside, almost gooey soft inside.

Service was slightly hit or miss.  A grumpy "seat yourself" at the door was a little mystifying (and carried a different message than a "oh sit anywhere you like" would have).  Service at the table was a little chaotic.  When our server periodically disappeared, we kept gong to the very friendly bartender to get additional things added to our bill, get the check, etc.

This place has a lot of reviews and I thought why not give it a try it's a complete no for me I mean maybe I came at a bad time or order the wrong meal I should have did fish and chips. Instead I did the donut burger with fries when my order was ready I got in the car drove a bit and said let me just take a bite of the fries the smell made me hungry. Man I bit into a crispy crispy burnt fry no seasoning and looked at the fry and said oh no so I reach to a stop light and open up the to go box looked at the fries man I was like why would you guys let this be ok they are overcook how do you mess up frys. Then I said I'm pulling over to try the burger at this point I went to grab it the whole bottom slid right off the whole burger too soggy I guess. I then just tore a piece the burger was ok now that I realized I had nothing to eat I went to captain Ds and just got some fish.

The best way I can sum up our visit to Cypress Street was "underwhelming and unimpressed". 

If you're looking for a spot with a great bar menu, great location, and a nice patio....I can see where this place has its perks. They have lots of outdoor seating (and are dog friendly) and in general, have a really appealing outdoor space. The service was a little slow when we went (people love their weekend brunch!), but to be fair the place was really busy and had LOTS of large parties. Our server was super friendly, so we didn't mind the slower service too much. 

What really kills me is how lack luster the food is. Maybe we didn't try the right items, I don't know....but I was so underwhelmed with everything we tried. The best thing we got was the Fried Green Tomato appetizer, the aioli sauce with the goat cheese was such a nice pairing with the tomatoes. For entrees, I got the vegetable frittata and y'all....I would HARDLY call this a frittata. It truly was just scrambled eggs on the bottom and saut√©ed peppers, onions, and spinach thrown on top. It was more of a scramble than a frittata. In general, it was just....meh. My husband got the gyro and again, it was another mediocre dish. He described it as a "feta bomb" , which I disagree but to be fair, I would eat a block of cheese without blinking BUT I DIGRESS. And the slaw had so much potential....but it had absolutely no spice or seasoning to it. It just tasted like slaw tossed in mayo. Overall, we were just underwhelmed with the dishes we chose. 

I feel like I would give this place another shot, possibly for dinner, as I feel like the outdoor patio views late at night would be killer. I just don't necessarily recommend this as a top brunch spot in Atlanta.

photos.caption: Vegetable Cypress Frittata with Hash Browns
Lamb Gyro with Jalapeno Slaw (the slaw is BO-RING)

comment.text: Strong spot to grab a bite to eat & drink a pint before or after the game. The Krispy Kreme hamburger paired with the chipotle cheese grits hit the spot!

photos.caption: A nice chill in the air while watching the game

comment.text:
Fucking joke. Got here at 11;30. And they said closed. Last call.  Called and said open to 12. Wasted time energy and fuel. 

Fucking joke

It's first come first serve but I grabbed a table for my group of five pretty quickly ... I had the fish and chips and it was delicious... our server was great
I would go back and recommend to friends to try it out

If you are near Georgia tech and looking for a great bite to eat and the prices are so affordable s colllege kid can live there then this is your spot. Staff is friendly and the beer is ice cold. Can you say 4 Dollor Sweetwater 420s cause I can

Not sure why this place has such high reviews- drinks were bland (was alcohol even in it??) and service was almost nonexistent due to busyness. I get that on a weekend night, it'll get busy, but if that's the case, hire more employees, thanks. We originally wanted 2 different drinks but they were unavailable. Fries were fine, but if you mess that up, how do you carry on as a bar? Location is the only great thing about this place. We need more bars in midtown!!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Grace, thank you for the recent review and I would like to apologize for the slow service you experienced during a busy weekend night. Please know we have added more servers and food runners to weekend shifts to improve our guest experience. Thanks again for the comments and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

comment.text: The pulled pork sandwich was delicious. They add slaw, pickles and mayo-an amazing combination of flavors and textures. They were very busy but service was still really good! I love eating here. The Krispy Kreme burger is also a must!

Legit local bar with delicious food. They have a plethora of beers to choose from, but also have a full bar available. This is a sit yourself restaurant, but the wait staff is super fast once you find an available table. My wife and I went here on a busy Saturday evening. We ordered a few brews, the salmon ceviche, seafood paella, and the cypress burger. The beers came out super fast and ice cold... I highly recommend the weihenstephaner hefe weissbier and the cypress house IPA. The cypress burger was extremely juicy and cooked medium. We would definitely come here again next time we are in downtown Atlanta.

While visiting my son at Georgia Tech, we enjoyed Cypress Street twice - once for lunch on the patio and once for a take-out dinner. The food and service are wonderful. My son's personal favorite is the Krispy Kreme burger. Mine was the brussel sprouts. Since these might not be eveyone else's types of yummies,  I can also recommend the Philly sandwich, Greek salad, pub fries, and lamb gyro.

This will 100% be a go-to restaurant when we're in town!!

This place was good for drinks and appetizers. I had the pizza egg rolls , wings and a vodka tonic. 
The atmosphere was good and the service was fast
I would definitely recommend this place

What a gem of a place!  Cypress Street Pint and Plate is a wonderful funky spot with very friendly, welcoming staff (Mallory I feel like we should invite you to Thanksgiving...you're the BEST!!) tucked away in a cozy part of midtown Atl.  The Brussel sprouts starter was the best...lip smacking goood, and the shrimp andouille sausage pepper and grits were OUT OF THIS WORLD delicious.  The hubs' fish and chips were super yummy, too.  Accompanied by a couple of bloody's with a nice side care pale ale really made for a fantastic afternoon out.  Thank you Cypress Street  Pint and Plate for making our day

Chris D. Took such good care of us. The patio is the best in the area. $3 mimosas on a Saturday? Yes please.
BBQ egg rolls, yes please
This place is my new jam 
And no stupid mask mandate BS

Will be back. Will send friends here. Love you guys

Great place to grab a cold beer, a burger, and people watch on the outdoor patio. 
* Outdoor seating is first come first serve. 
* Dog friendly and COVID friendly
Went here for Saturday brunch before going to the Fox Theatre. The food was very good. Had the french toast and a mimosa. The $3 mimosa is the best deal in town.
Went to this place after a place a few blocks away disappointed. Great food and will be back. Excellent service as well and price points were very good. Had the chicken piccata and would recommend.

Meh, the appetizers were good. The wings were cold and small, fries completely cold even after the second time they came out. Burger to be honest was pretty gross, burgers are my favorite food and for bar food this place just isn't it. I'm sure it was good at one time but the quality just doesn't seem to be there. The waiters and waitresses were awesome though! Oh and a sour beer was $7 and a Miller light was $5 I'm not sure where they get off charging that. 

Short answer I wouldn't go back here for bar food, if you want an atmosphere to watch some games outside then that's cool.

What a great place to hang out not far from Fox Theater. It's a bit off the beaten path and why it's a great find. Great beer selection, service and food were awesome! Good neighborhood feel. Nice indoor and outdoor seating. Will be back.

Cypress is the savior of my many nights, prolly favorite place around Tech where you can do anything and everything. Great place to hangout especially in the summer. I won't get into the menu, they have everything as others mentioned. Their sweet potatoes are to die for. Also I like the seasonal cocktails and happy hours.

Closes around 2.30 am (theoretical), 3.30 am (practical). Yay Cypress!
Great local bar with great bartenders! One of our go-to spots! Can't beat the everyday $3 house IPA!  The staff is amazing!  But I do miss the Mac & cheese :(

I'll keep this short and sweet - if you're looking for a cute patio for getting f*cked up without cutting a whole in your pocket, look no further. Screw $20 bottomless mimosas - go here and get $3 mimosas and sweetwater 420s. The pretzel was pretty dank too.

Whoa!

Let's stop. Take a moment and recognize the fact that I just had the best burger in my life. Are you kidding me? Is this possible? Like the artery clogging donut bun, cheddar dripping, caramelized onions, beefy bacon burger was to die for. It was so good. I mean I greedily ate it on 75 on my way home lol!

It looked like your typical hole in the wall college burger joint. But man! It was perfect. Definitely hit the spot. 

The menus were weird - on clipboards. I'm not Sure how the parking was because I walked over but it didn't appear to be any...

The menu was also confusing as I thought you could only order the items on that day listed but I saw a previous review on this burger and fries so I got it. I paid exactly $15.16 with tax so just be prepared to pay around that Amount. 

Burger took about 10 mins to make and well worth the wait. I'm not typically this greedy about a review lol but this was a good one. Glad I chose this place over Vortex

photos.caption: What's left of it on ride home

comment.text:
I wished the pizza eggrolls were more like huge pizzarolls... I almost thought that was what it was and got excited about the menu.. the rolls tasted EXACTLY like pizza .. not bad but... how epic would pizza rolls be late at night... 


Back again  love the old fashions and late night menu!
Cypress St. is a great place to grab a beer after work. They have a big outdoor patio. Although they have a great munchies menu, there aren't a ton of veggie options.

3rd time dining here and haven't been disappointed yet. If you've never had a Krispie Kreme burger, DO iT!!! Taste like happiness! Mac and cheese was boring af...although you could add salt n pepper yourself. Pizza eggrolls were awe-mazing! This place is hip!

photos.caption: Krispie Kreme burger w/ mac and cheese
